item.title: Create Startup Script in Linux
item.author: cyrusncy@gmail.com (CyrusN)
item.description: Create a new script in /etc/init.d/myscript. vi /etc/init.d/myscript (Obviously it doesn’t have to be called “myscript”.) In this script, do whatever you want to do. Perhaps just run the script you mentioned. #!/bin/sh /path/to/my/script.sh Make it executable. chmod 755 /etc/init.d/myscript Configure the init system to run this script at startup. update-rc.d myscript defaults ystem to run this script at startup. update-rc.d myscript defaults
